com.rigado.rigablue

Class RigFirmwareUpdateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rigado.rigablue.RigFirmwareUpdateManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRigFirmwareUpdateServiceObserver, IRigLeConnectionManagerObserver, IRigLeDiscoveryManagerObserver

    public class RigFirmwareUpdateManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRigLeDiscoveryManagerObserver, IRigLeConnectionManagerObserver, IRigFirmwareUpdateServiceObserver
    This class manages the entire firmware update process based on the provided input images and bootloader reset command.

      • updateFirmware

        public boolean updateFirmware(RigLeBaseDevice device,
                              java.io.InputStream firmwareImage,
                              android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic activateCharacteristic,
                              byte[] activateCommand)
        Performs a firmware update.
        Parameters:
        device - The device to update
        firmwareImage - The firmware image to send to the device
        activateCharacteristic - The #BluetoothGattCharacteristic to which the activate command is sent in order to cause the bootloader to start
        activateCommand - The bootloader activation command to write to the activateCharacteristic
        Returns:
        Returns true if the firmware update started successfully, false otherwise

      • cancelUpdate

        public void cancelUpdate()
        Cancels an in progress firmware update. Sets mState to FirmwareManagerStateEnum.State_Cancelled and prevents reconnection attempts. This method should only be called after a successful connection to the bootloader. We send a reset command to potentially reset any long-running bootloader advertising process. However, if RigDfu has been discovered, and a connection is in progress, but not completed, it may still continue to connect in the background. To prevent this, store a reference to the bootloader RigAvailableDeviceData and cancel the pending connection before calling cancelUpdate(). See the below example: mConnectionManager.cancelConnection(mRigDfuAvailableDeviceData); The reset (or cancelled connection) will trigger didDisconnectDevice(BluetoothDevice) or didDisconnectPeripheral() depending on connection state at the time of the cancel. Either callback will pass the correct error code to handleUpdateError(RigDfuError).

      • didDisconnectPeripheral

        public void didDisconnectPeripheral()
        Called when the bootloader peripheral disconnects. If the firmware update was successful, then the connection observer will be reassigned and this method will not be invoked. We check state here, because disconnection could be caused by cancelling an in progress update. However, if it is not `State_Cancelled`, then we know the bootloader connection failed.
        Specified by:
        didDisconnectPeripheral in interface IRigFirmwareUpdateServiceObserver

      • didConnectDevice

        public void didConnectDevice(RigLeBaseDevice device)
        Called after a successful connection has been made to the bootloader device. We check for FirmwareManagerStateEnum.State_Cancelled here and trigger a reset if the update has been cancelled. See cancelUpdate() for more information.
        Specified by:
        didConnectDevice in interface IRigLeConnectionManagerObserver
        Parameters:
        device - The newly connected device

      • didDisconnectDevice
